name: places/ChIJE2nXzvxZwokRzJYEYHEXVw4
formattedAddress: 159 E 53rd St 3rd floor, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 159 E 53rd St 3rd floor, New York, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text: If you want a dedicated doctor who will closely follow your treatment and journey, Dr Devore is unfortunately not it. While my egg freezing attempt here was unsuccessful, the most disappointing part was being treated as a number rather than a person. The NYU Langone fertility centre is generally a factory given the number of patients they have, but Dr Devore took it a step further by going on holiday mid treatment, without informing me. I only found out when I said ‘see you on Monday’ (day of my retrieval), and only then did she inform me that she was on holiday and another doctor would be performing my retrieval. She also failed to listen to my concerns about the  trigger shot (as I had a previous unsuccessful retrieval at another facility). This led to another unsuccessful retrieval. Instead of discussing with me options, she only said there could be a variety of factors and suggested I don’t go through another attempt as it could lead to another failure. She basically gave me no hope and did not take it as a challenge to try and find a solution, even when I shared articles about cases like mine to show that several things could be done to improve outcomes. Several months later, I have had a successful experience at a smaller facility where the Dr and entire team were 100% dedicated to my journey: the new Dr took me through the possible reasons for my two unsuccessful attempts, followed my natural cycle to learn how my body works, and the Dr gave a protocol that worked! So my advice to any patients who  have specific fertility concerns or diagnosis, or who expect a Dr that will fully be dedicated to your personal journey, is to find another doctor. I wish I had known this and saved myself thousands of dollars.

text.text: If you want a dedicated doctor who will closely follow your treatment and journey, Dr Devore is unfortunately not it. While my egg freezing attempt here was unsuccessful, the most disappointing part was being treated as a number rather than a person. The NYU Langone fertility centre is generally a factory given the number of patients they have, but Dr Devore took it a step further by going on holiday mid treatment, without informing me. I only found out when I said ‘see you on Monday’ (day of my retrieval), and only then did she inform me that she was on holiday and another doctor would be performing my retrieval. She also failed to listen to my concerns about the  trigger shot (as I had a previous unsuccessful retrieval at another facility). This led to another unsuccessful retrieval. Instead of discussing with me options, she only said there could be a variety of factors and suggested I don’t go through another attempt as it could lead to another failure. She basically gave me no hope and did not take it as a challenge to try and find a solution, even when I shared articles about cases like mine to show that several things could be done to improve outcomes. Several months later, I have had a successful experience at a smaller facility where the Dr and entire team were 100% dedicated to my journey: the new Dr took me through the possible reasons for my two unsuccessful attempts, followed my natural cycle to learn how my body works, and the Dr gave a protocol that worked! So my advice to any patients who  have specific fertility concerns or diagnosis, or who expect a Dr that will fully be dedicated to your personal journey, is to find another doctor. I wish I had known this and saved myself thousands of dollars.

originalText.text: After years of fertility treatment at four prior clinics, I was paired with Dr. Devore by chance. Being under her care was a reparative experience. Dr. Devore was keen to understand my reactions to some of the drugs I was previously on (panic attacks), and she set me on a much better course. Prior doctors did not care about how the medications were affecting me and did not offer alternatives. There were a couple of times under her care when things did not work out for us (miscarriages). During these times, Dr. Devore was empathic and kind--quick to reach out and to stay on the phone. My partner and I felt taken care of in a system that previously left us feeling unconsidered and used. Strong recommend!

originalText.text: Dr Devore is unbelievably good. She knows ALL the stats, and it's clear she really relies on evidence-based medicine. She is also very warm and kind, and personally called me when there were any issues or questions. After I miscarried my first two euploid embryos, she referred me to reproductive immunology because of my history with lupus. Now I have a four month old son and couldn't be happier with the care I received from Dr Devore. I will absolutely return to her for my next retrieval and transfer.

originalText.text: Unlike other reviews, Dr. Devore has been thorough, kind, & very helpful. Also, her team is communicative and on top of things (med’s, labs, paperwork galore, etc.). Of course we, as the patients, have responsibility to call insurance and get the med’s delivered to our home when it applies & more, but the whole team has been solid as a whole. I’d recommend Dr. Devore for sure

originalText.text: This fertility doctor did no comprehensive follow ups prior to the procedure, no explanation of blood results, no discussion about medication risks after office visit, no concerns for my fertility journey, barely had an indepth conversation with my husband and I. I wouldn't recommend this doctor to anyone. If patients are turning to you for help, show more concern for them instead of being distant with a "nonchalant approach".
